intro: Achillea serbica, commonly known as Serbica yarrow, is a perennial herb native to southeastern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its flat, composite flower heads that range from white to pale yellow. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender, aromatic stems and basal leaves that are linear to lanceolate in shape. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
